resources.string: Few sights in the world compare to Athen\'s Acropolis, with its Parthenon temple perched high on a rocky crag keeping watch over centuries of civilization.
Founded in the 19th century, Athens\' National Archaeological Museum is the largest archaeological museum in Greece and one of the greatest antiquities museums in the world.
This interesting museum offers fascinating insights into the Byzantine period of Greek history.
Agora: Ruins of the Ancient Marketplace

The ancient Agora was the marketplace and the center of everyday life in ancient Athens. For an impressive view of the Agora from afar, head to the north wall of the Acropolis or the roads from the Areopagus.
On the site of the ancient Agora, the Church of the Holy Apostles was the only building left standing when this entire quarter of Athens was demolished to excavate the Agora archaeological site.

Gracing a little square that opens onto Ermoú Street, the Panaghia Kapnikaréa Church is a delightful place to visit. This beautiful little church was saved from demolition in the 19th century by the intervention of King Ludwig I of Bavaria.
Dedicated to Zeus, the Olympeion was the largest temple in ancient Greece. Though the Parthenon is better preserved, the Temple of Olympian Zeus was an even more monumental structure in its day.
City Center near Athens Gate & Athanasiou Diakou Str.

Ancient Athens\'s largest building, the Panathenaic Stadium, has a capacity for 60,000 spectators. Constructed around 335 BC during the era of Herodes Atticus, the venue hosted the Panathenaic Games where runners competed in races around the track.

Between the northern slopes of the Acropolis and Ermoú Street, the picturesque Pláka neighborhood boasts two important archaeological sites on Pepopida Street: the first-century BC Roman Agora and the second-century Library of Hadrian.
Changing of the Guard at Syntagma Square

For many tourists, watching the Changing of the Guard at Syntagma Square is an exciting and memorable experience. The Soldiers of the Presidential Guard stand in front of the Hellenic Parliament on Syntagma Square 24 hours a day, year-round.
The poster child of advanced modern Greek cuisine in a cutting-edge design space at the Onassis Cultural Center moves to an equally alluring rooftop during the summer.

Concept restaurant by a local collective of star chefs dedicated to progressive Greek cuisine; extraordinary local ingredients, sourced from places you didn’t even know existed, are served up in its bright, airy hall.
Stylish Greek bistro with a New York vibe serving extraordinary meats and seafood, that earned its reputation as the outpost of a famous island restaurant.

Multi-awarded French haute cuisine restaurant, widely regarded as the best of the city, that also offers world class desserts to sweeten further the dining experience in a beautiful old Athenian building and courtyard.
Stylish wine bar which recently graduated to a full-blown hip restaurant in a new, larger space in Kolonaki without losing its charming, preppy looks.
A favorite of the Athens taste critics, this award-winning restaurant offers sophisticated Greek cuisine in a tasteful neoclassical setting with a beautiful garden in summer.
The restaurant of the Athens Concert Hall which serves up satisfying Mediterranean cuisine in the plush setting of one of the city’s most beautiful ‘secret’ gardens.
A chic, concept restaurant with a fabulous garden serving accessible Mediterranean cuisine, as well as comfort food, at commendable prices.
Stylish wine restaurant tucked away next to one of the many staircases of Lycabettus hill with an interior resembling a modern cellar and an extensive wine list of primarily local vino.
Gourmet restaurant serving impeccably executed French and Mediterranean cuisine by one of the most promising young Greek chefs in a clean-cut space that puts the food center stage.
Galaxy bar and restaurant on the rooftop of the Athens Hilton is a wonderful place to pass the evening, with a breathtaking view, elegant atmosphere and high quality service.
Baba au Rum opened in 2009 and was the first bar which approached rum and the cocktail culture in a completely different way.
Centrally located in Karitsi Square, one of the most beautiful hidden corners near Syntagma Square, the Gin Joint is a small bar for serious drinks.
Located in an atmospheric alley, with a shady plane tree and an intimate interior space, this successful bar has become a favorite in Athens, from the first day it opened.
Jazz in Jazz on Deinokratous street, on the way up to Lycabettus hill, is unique in its kind and a reference point in the neighborhood for an eclectic public.
The history of Low Profile started in 1996, when a small butcher shop on Lykavittou street in Kolonaki was transformed into a Whiskey Bar which immediately attracted people from all over Athens.
Ippopotamos is the oldest functioning rock bar in Athens and can be found in the same location since 1978 when it first opened.

At Noel, on central Kolokotroni street, customers are welcomed as guests, in a warm atmosphere. A team of experts pooled their experience and created a bar/restaurant with unique style in this atmospheric arcade.

Underdog on Irakleidon pedestrian street in Thission, is one of the most successful new arrivals on the Athens day and night scene. Its opening confirmed that Irakleidon street is one of the most hip places in town.
Rock & Balls on lively Agias Irinis square is a popular hang out with industrial design, Bauhaus style, an imaginative menu and original cocktails.
Boasting deluxe amenities including a limousine service, Amalia Hotel Athens is situated in Athens and is a recipient of a Green Key Award.

Situated in Athens, Plaka Hotel Athens is a 10-minute walk from Syntagma Square and provides a rooftop terrace. Located close to well-known landmarks, the hotel also features views of the Acropolis of Athens, the Acropolis Museum and Acropolis.
Airotel Parthenon provides modern 4-star accommodation in Athens. It is close to the Acropolis Museum, dining options and shops.

Boasting a rooftop terrace, Attalos Hotel is situated in Athens and provides historic accommodation. Located near well-known attractions, the hotel also features views of the Acropolis Museum, Acropolis and the Acropolis of Athens.

Featuring a popular location, Herodion Hotel provides views of the Acropolis Museum, Acropolis and Athens, and is conveniently close to a multitude of dining options. This elegant hotel is located in Central Athens.

Located in Athens, Melia Athens is a 10-minute walk from the National Archaeological Museum and offers an outdoor pool, a sauna and a Jacuzzi. It has a spa and wellness centre, as well as a Turkish steam bath, free Wi-Fi and a coffee bar.

Situated in Athens, Electra Palace Hotel Athens is a 10-minute walk from Syntagma Square and offers a Jacuzzi, a sauna and a rooftop pool. Some of the premium facilities at this modern 5-star hotel include a rooftop terrace and free wireless internet.
Set in Athens, The Athens Gate Hotel is a five-minute walk from the Arch of Hadrian and provides a rooftop terrace and a Jacuzzi. Guests can also enjoy free Wi-Fi.
President Hotel Athens features a rooftop pool in addition to a pool-side bar. This 4-star hotel is close to everything Athens has to offer.
Boasting views of the Temple of Olympian Zeus, Royal Olympic Hotel is near Athens\'s popular tourist spots. It also offers a sauna, a swimming pool and a rooftop terrace.
